sub_topic: Finding the minimum spanning tree of a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph G with 7 vertices and 11 edges with edge weights given in the table below. Find the minimum spanning tree of G.

| Edge | Weight |
|------|--------|
| 1-2  | 3      |
| 1-3  | 5      |
| 1-4  | 7      |
| 1-5  | 1      |
| 2-3  | 6      |
| 2-5  | 4      |
| 2-6  | 2      |
| 3-4  | 9      |
| 4-5  | 8      |
| 4-7  | 10     |
| 6-7  | 11     |
message_2:
To find the minimum spanning tree of G, we can use Kruskal's algorithm. First, we sort the edges in ascending order of their weights:

1. 1-5 (1)
2. 2-6 (2)
3. 1-2 (3)
4. 2-5 (4)
5. 1-3 (5)
6. 2-3 (6)
7. 1-4 (7)
8. 4-5 (8)
9. 3-4 (9)
10. 4-7 (10)
11. 6-7 (11)

Now, we add edges to the minimum spanning tree while ensuring that no cycles are formed:

1. Add edge 1-5 (1)
2. Add edge 2-6 (2)
3. Add edge 1-2 (3)
4. Add edge 2-5 (4) - this would create a cycle with edges 1-5 and 1-2, so skip it
5. Add edge 1-3 (5)
6. Add edge 2-3 (6) - this would create a cycle with edges 1-2 and 1-3, so skip it
7. Add edge 1-4 (7) - this would create a cycle with edges 1-3 and 1-5, so skip it
8. Add edge 4-5 (8)
9. Add edge 3-4 (9) - this would create a cycle with edges 1-3, 1-5, and 4-5, so skip it
10. Add edge 4-7 (10)
11. Add edge 6-7 (11) - this would create a cycle with edges 2-6 and 4-7, so skip it

The minimum spanning tree of G consists of the following edges:

1-5 (1), 2-6 (2), 1-2 (3), 1-3 (5), 4-5 (8), and 4-7 (10)

The total weight of the minimum spanning tree is 1 + 2 + 3 + 5 + 8 + 10 = 29.
